TopicTitle: [BDA] [1.1.3] Airborne Heavy Weapons Platform Challenge- Battles Begin Soon

Articles.Content:
@njmksr I think having a minimum SVTOL requirement would be fine, but you should have a set distance which the AWHPs should be able to take off, say, where the hangar is.

@DoctorDavinci You were right, the current BDA AI can't handle AWHPs dependent on VTOL engines for lift. When I was testing the liberator, I couldn't tell whether its inability to maintain altitude was because of the AI, or because its steer factor was set to 1, which is why I said the AI handled it fine. And my entries...well, they're basically planes with VTOL engines, and we all know the AI can handle planes fine.

I’m curious. Does my Asterion qualify?

https://kerbalx.com/Mycroft_33/Asterion

Here’s a picture: 

From the KerbalX description:

"CMAU Incorporated proudly presents for your military campaigns the most heavily armed VTOL for its size, the one and only Asterion! Absolutely bristling with missiles, this impressive VTOL carries 22 AIM-120 AMRAAMs, 22 AIM-9 Sidewinder Missiles, 8 ‘Vulcan’ 20MM machine gun turrets, and one CBU-87 cluster bomb. Capable of playing the role of both fighter and bomber, this is one VTOL you don’t want to get on the bad side of. This little VTOL may not be fast, but it can land anywhere, fly straight up, stop and turn on a dime, fly sideways, and is even capable of flying backwards stably! It can fly steadily no matter how many missiles you’ve fired, and is capable of high precision bombing, featuring a deluxe radar system capable of locking on to two different targets at once."

 

Note: Top speed in horizontal mode is ~100m/s, so it’s not super fast. But it literally can turn on a dime. TCA not required. List of mods and action groups on the KerbalX page. Oh! Almost forgot! My computer is absolute **** right now, and can barely run KSP, let alone launch anything big. I can’t host a match with this or pretty much any other craft, so I don’t know who will. My KSP adventures are on pause right now.

EDIT: It seems from the OP that SpannerMonkey is handling this kind of thing, so thanks to him!

@njmksr If you're going to nerf laser and missile damage, you should also nerf gun damage, as most parts are destroyed by a few hits from 20mm rounds. The only stock part I know of that provides significant resistance against 20mm bullets are mk3 cargo bays (I built an armored fighter that exploits this!), but I am not going to spend a month redesigning my aircraft to accommodate them.

On a side note, 30mm bullets are actually overall weaker than 20mm bullets in BDA, since they spread their heat out over an area like missiles, rather than applying all of their heat at once on a part it hits like 20mm bullets. I'm not saying they're balanced, however. 30mm rounds still would destroy AWHP's unrealistically quickly, and would also have to be correspondingly nerfed.
